gui

Class BasicRobot

  • java.lang.Object
    • gui.BasicRobot
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Robot

    public class BasicRobot
extends java.lang.Object
implements Robot

    Basic implementation of the Robot interface. Provides functionality for an entity to navigate a maze while being aware of its orientation within the maze. In order for a robot to be present while playing a game, Controller must receive a boolean value true in its constructor to instantiate a robot.

    BasicRobot tells the GUI (Controller) to change when an operation (move, rotate, jump) is successfully performed by way of its keyDown method. It receives key commands redirected by the Controller to the robot from SimpleKeyListener.

    In a forthcoming project it will be driven by a RobotDriver to explore a maze programmatically. Algorithms to be implemented: Wall-Follower & Wizard.

    Author:
    Elijah Mas

      • getBatteryLevel

        public float getBatteryLevel()
        Description copied from interface: Robot
        Returns the current battery level. The robot has a given battery level (energy level) that it draws energy from during operations. The particular energy consumption is device dependent such that a call for distance2Obstacle may use less energy than a move forward operation. If battery level <= 0 then robot stops to function and hasStopped() is true.
        Specified by:
        getBatteryLevel in interface Robot
        Returns:
        current battery level, level is > 0 if operational.

      • setBatteryLevel

        public void setBatteryLevel(float level)
        Description copied from interface: Robot
        Sets the current battery level. The robot has a given battery level (energy level) that it draws energy from during operations. The particular energy consumption is device dependent such that a call for distance2Obstacle may use less energy than a move forward operation. If battery level <= 0 then robot stops to function and hasStopped() is true.
        Specified by:
        setBatteryLevel in interface Robot
        Parameters:
        level - is the current battery level

      • resetOdometer

        public void resetOdometer()
        Description copied from interface: Robot
        Resets the odomoter counter to zero. The robot has an odometer that calculates the distance the robot has moved. Whenever the robot moves forward, the distance that it moves is added to the odometer counter. The odometer reading gives the path length if its setting is 0 at the start of the game.
        Specified by:
        resetOdometer in interface Robot

      • getEnergyForFullRotation

        public float getEnergyForFullRotation()
        Description copied from interface: Robot
        Gives the energy consumption for a full 360 degree rotation. Scaling by other degrees approximates the corresponding consumption.
        Specified by:
        getEnergyForFullRotation in interface Robot
        Returns:
        energy for a full rotation

      • getEnergyForStepForward

        public float getEnergyForStepForward()
        Description copied from interface: Robot
        Gives the energy consumption for moving forward for a distance of 1 step. For simplicity, we assume that this equals the energy necessary to move 1 step backwards and that scaling by a larger number of moves is approximately the corresponding multiple.
        Specified by:
        getEnergyForStepForward in interface Robot
        Returns:
        energy for a single step forward

      • getOdometerReading

        public int getOdometerReading()
        Description copied from interface: Robot
        Gets the distance traveled by the robot. The robot has an odometer that calculates the distance the robot has moved. Whenever the robot moves forward, the distance that it moves is added to the odometer counter. The odometer reading gives the path length if its setting is 0 at the start of the game. The counter can be reset to 0 with resetOdomoter().
        Specified by:
        getOdometerReading in interface Robot
        Returns:
        the distance traveled measured in single-cell steps forward

      • distanceToObstacle

        public int distanceToObstacle(Robot.Direction direction)
                       throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Description copied from interface: Robot
        Tells the distance to an obstacle (a wall) in the given direction. The direction is relative to the robot's current forward direction. Distance is measured in the number of cells towards that obstacle, e.g. 0 if the current cell has a wallboard in this direction, 1 if it is one step forward before directly facing a wallboard, Integer.MaxValue if one looks through the exit into eternity.
        Specified by:
        distanceToObstacle in interface Robot
        Parameters:
        direction - specifies the direction of the sensor
        Returns:
        number of steps towards obstacle if obstacle is visible in a straight line of sight, Integer.MAX_VALUE otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the robot does not have an operational sensor for this direction

      • calculateObstacleDistance

        private int calculateObstacleDistance(Robot.Direction direction)
                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Compute and store the distance to a wall in a given direction. Returns true if the distance could be calculated successfully.
        Parameters:
        direction - a value of Direction
        Returns:
        true if the distance was calculated successfully
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - originates from getCurrentPosition called in getObstacleDistance

      • hasOperationalSensor

        public boolean hasOperationalSensor(Robot.Direction direction)
        Description copied from interface: Robot
        Tells if the robot has an operational distance sensor for the given direction. The interface is generic and may be implemented with robots that are more or less equipped with sensor or have sensors that are subject to failures and repairs. The purpose is to allow for a flexible robot driver to adapt its driving strategy according the features it finds supported by a robot.
        Specified by:
        hasOperationalSensor in interface Robot
        Parameters:
        direction - specifies the direction of the sensor
        Returns:
        true if robot has operational sensor, false otherwise

      • triggerSensorFailure

        public void triggerSensorFailure(Robot.Direction direction)
        Description copied from interface: Robot
        Makes the robot's distance sensor for the given direction fail. Subsequent calls to measure the distance to an obstacle in this direction will return with an exception. If the robot does not have a sensor in this direction, the method does not have any effect. Only distance sensors can fail, the room sensor and exit sensor if installed are always operational.
        Specified by:
        triggerSensorFailure in interface Robot
        Parameters:
        direction - specifies the direction of the sensor

      • repairFailedSensor

        public boolean repairFailedSensor(Robot.Direction direction)
        Description copied from interface: Robot
        Makes the robot's distance sensor for the given direction operational again. A method call for an already operational sensor has no effect but returns true as the robot has an operational sensor for this direction. A method call for a sensor that the robot does not have has not effect and the method returns false.
        Specified by:
        repairFailedSensor in interface Robot
        Parameters:
        direction - specifies the direction of the sensor
        Returns:
        true if robot has operational sensor, false otherwise

      • rotateRight

        private void rotateRight()
        Rotate the robot rightwards, adjusting required fields. Cause a failure if energy is depleted.

      • rotateLeft

        private void rotateLeft()
        Rotate the robot leftwards, adjusting required fields. Cause a failure if energy is depleted.

      • rotate

        public void rotate(Robot.Turn turn)
        Description copied from interface: Robot
        Turn robot on the spot for amount of degrees. If robot runs out of energy, it stops, which can be checked by hasStopped() == true and by checking the battery level.
        Specified by:
        rotate in interface Robot

      • catchPosition

        private int[] catchPosition()

      • move

        public void move(int distance,
                 boolean manual)
        Description copied from interface: Robot
        Moves robot forward a given number of steps. A step matches a single cell. If the robot runs out of energy somewhere on its way, it stops, which can be checked by hasStopped() == true and by checking the battery level. If the robot hits an obstacle like a wall, it depends on the mode of operation what happens. If an algorithm drives the robot, it remains at the position in front of the obstacle and also hasStopped() == true as this is not supposed to happen. This is also helpful to recognize if the robot implementation and the actual maze do not share a consistent view on where walls are and where not. If a user manually operates the robot, this behavior is inconvenient for a user, such that in case of a manual operation the robot remains at the position in front of the obstacle but hasStopped() == false and the game can continue.
        Specified by:
        move in interface Robot
        Parameters:
        distance - is the number of cells to move in the robot's current forward direction
        manual - is true if robot is operated manually by user, false otherwise

      • incrementCurrentPosition

        private void incrementCurrentPosition()
        Increment the robot's position according to the current forward direction.

      • endGame

        private void endGame(java.lang.String failureMessage)
        Cause the game to end because of a robot failure. The robot informs the controller about the cause of failure.
        Parameters:
        failureMessage - a description of why the robot failed.

      • moveSingle

        private void moveSingle(boolean manual)
        Move the robot one position forward, adjusting required fields. Cause a failure if energy is depleted or the robot crashes.

      • jump

        public void jump()
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: Robot
        Makes robot move in a forward direction even if there is a wall in front of it. In this sense, the robot jumps over the wall if necessary. The distance is always 1 step and the direction is always forward.
        Specified by:
        jump in interface Robot
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - is thrown if the chosen wall is an exterior wall and the robot would land outside of the maze that way. The current location remains set at the last position, same for direction but the game is supposed to end with a failure.

      • atForwardWall

        private boolean atForwardWall()
        Check if there is a wall immediately in front of the robot.
        Returns:
        true if distance to forward wall is 0

      • setDistance

        private void setDistance(Robot.Direction d,
                         int value)

      • changeDistancesInMoveForward

        private void changeDistancesInMoveForward()
        Increment the robot's backward distance and decrement the forward distance, as happens when the robot moves forward. Get the left/right distances by using sensors. Designed to optimize energy usage.

      • changeEnergyLevel

        private void changeEnergyLevel(float amount)
        Change the energy level of the robot by a given amount. Cause the robot to stop if there is insufficient battery.
        Parameters:
        amount - energy depleted by an operation

      • attemptEnergyDepletion

        private boolean attemptEnergyDepletion(float amount)
        Wrapper around changeEnergyLevel(float) to test if robot has stopped in attempting an operation.
        Parameters:
        amount - energy depleted by an operation
        Returns:
        whether the robot had enough battery to perform the operation

                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Get the distance to a wall in a particular direction. Makes use of floorplan.
